page.title: 20Transport in Grundisburgh
page.content: Roads: The village is served only by "B" Class or Unclassified roads. 83 o/o of families have use of a car. 17 o/o do not possess private transport or use motorcycles etc. Services:69 o/o of households use the 'bus.(Woodbridge-Grundisburgh-Ipswich, 8 in each direction, Monday-Saturday). There is an expressed need for both an earlier and later 'bus service than that provided. A "School 'Bus brings children from outlying villages and to the Middle and High schools. There is a local Taxi service. Railway facilities are available from Woodbridge, 5 kms,(Ipswich-Lowestoft), Ipswich, 10 kms, (Intercity). Problems: Parking facilities; speed of traffic through village; congestion near school; provision of adequate pavements; condition of roads.
